title.narrative: Enhance civilian security in areas secured from Islamic State (IS) through increased knowledge of Explosive Remnants of War (ERW) threats, clearance of ERW contamination and improved national capacity to respond.

description.narrative: The goal of this project is to facilitate the safe and timely return of IDPs in Ninewa and Diyala governorates, through increased national mine action capacity and clearance of ERW from areas prioritized for return. To accomplish this, MAG will deploy four Multi-Task Teams, two survey teams, one Mechanical team, and two mechanical support teams along with four mechanical assets. Under this project the following outputs will be accomplished: 1,080,000m2 cleared, 9,000m3 of ground processed, 432,000m2 of land technically surveyed, 40 contamination and damage assessments carried out, and 432 MRE sessions delivered to 6,480 people.

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity

sector.narrative: Conflict Prevention and Resolution/Peace and Security
